Management assessment is the third of four indicators to be assessed under the PHAS rule issued to reflect the operations of the REAC and includes: Â· Vacant unit turnaround time Â· Capital Fund Â· Work Orders Â· Annual inspection of dwelling units and systems Â· Security Â· Economic self-sufficiency MASS is currently broken up into 6 implementation releases. Releases 1, 2, 3 and 4 have been previously implemented into production. Releases 5 and 6 carry all SDM phases of the MASS initiative into FY 2002. Release 5 was developed to support the REAC invalidation process, improve the evaluative nature of the current management indicators, enhance navigation and improve the current pages with updated and/or new information. Release 6 has focused on the development of new management reporting functions and the improvement of existing reporting functions. Additional Software Tools not listed in Programming and Software Environment: * MS Visual Studio 2006

HUD/iNtegrated%20Assessment%20Sub-System.name: iNtegrated Assessment Sub-System
HUD/iNtegrated%20Assessment%20Sub-System.description: System and infrastructure for gathering all the REAC PHA assessment results,analyzing the data and reporting results to the REACs business partners. Supports the PHAS rule. NASS will be the REACs main communication and reporting tool for PHAs and those in HUD charged with regulating and/or monitoring PHAs. System links financial, management, physical and resident assessment results and provides PHAS scores and analyses. Analyses include risk analysis, prescriptive advice, peer comparison, fraud analysis, and trend analysis. These analyses can be used by HUD to provide further insight into PHAs overall performance. Additional Software tools that are not listed in the Programming and Communications Environment Section: â€¢ MS Visual Studio 2006

HUD/Web%20Access%20Security%20System.name: Web Access Security System
HUD/Web%20Access%20Security%20System.description: The purpose of the WEB Access Security System (WASS) is to provide a common framework for administering application-level security for HUD systems. HUD's internal staff and external trusted business partners require access to many of HUD's proprietary systems. In order to provide secured, controlled access to these systems, the Secure Systems and Secure Connection are components of REAC's WEB Access Security System (WASS). New systems developed for HUD that require secure access to proprietary HUD information must use the WASS security framework. WASS supports a growing number of systems and users. WASS will continually seek to make improvements to its existing system and communication processes.

HUD/Quality%20Assessment%20Sub-System.name: Quality Assessment Sub-System
HUD/Quality%20Assessment%20Sub-System.description: Implementation of quality assessment software and infrastructure. Supports HUD 2020 reform to support cross cutting assessments of independent public accountants, single family appraisers, public housing agencies and multi-family owners and agents and identifies high performers for deregulation. Supports the PHAS rule by ensuring the quality of the rating and monitoring public housing projects. Supports planned multi-family assessment rule and addressees multi-family monitoring material weakness by quality reviews. Scope: Implementation of QA processes for Financial and physical Inspection processes, communication/reporting, referrals, tracking. Additional software tools not listed in the Programming and Software Environment Section: * MS Visual Studio 2006

HUD/Physical%20Assessment%20Sub-System-P.name: Physical Assessment Sub-System-PIH/REAC
HUD/Physical%20Assessment%20Sub-System-P.description: Implementation of physical assessment software and infrastructure. Supports HUD 2020 reform to support cross cutting assessments of public housing and multi-family housing and identifies high performers for deregulation. Supports the PHAS rule by rating and monitoring public housing projects. Supports the Lead-Based Paint Inspection rule. Supports planned multi-family assessment rule and addresses multi-family monitoring material weakness. Real Estate Assessment Center's (REAC) mission is to monitor and assess the condition of properties and performance of the entities managing or owning housing in which the Department has a financial interest or statutory obligation to monitor. The stated mission is the focal point of HUD 2020 reform efforts. The Office of Inspector General (OIG) reports that $65.6 billion of HUD's reported net position comprises funds appropriated to HUD to provide housing and community development assistance. These funds are at risk as identified in the material weaknesses and reportable conditions outlined in the 1998 OIG audit. The REAC is responsible for amending and, where practicable, correcting the following material weaknesses and reportable conditions related to the need to: Â·Ensure that subsidies are based upon the correct tenant income; Improve monitoring of multifamily projects; Continue to place more emphasis on early warning and loss prevention for FHA insured mortgages; Â·Improve FHA's information technology systems to support their business process more effectively; Â·Improve HUD's management control programs; Refine performance measures to effectively implement results management; Improve controls over project-based subsidy payments; and Â·Enhance the design and operation of FHA's information systems' general and application controls. Scope: communication/Reporting, System enhancements (multiple hits, partial inspections), trend analysis, integration.

HUD/Configuration%20Management%20for%20U.name: Configuration Management for Unisys
HUD/Configuration%20Management%20for%20U.description: CMPLUS provides a development environment that includes software configuration management, problem tracking, application building and installation. CMPLUS will: Â· Allow identification of all components that comprise a particular change or release Â· Provide Application Baseline Management Â· Provide Application Transfer Â· Enable role based security Â· Guarantee source to object integrity Â· Manage software versions throughout the development life cycle Â· Provide audit facilities and reporting tools Â· Provide automated build facilities Â· Provide the ability to identify and revert to a previous baseline Â· Provide Source Control Â· Support and manage parallel (concurrent) development.

HUD/PIH%20Inventory%20Management%20Syste.name: PIH Inventory Management System
HUD/PIH%20Inventory%20Management%20Syste.description: IMS is based on Microsoft Windows DNA, with Active Server Pages as a front end. It uses XSL, XML and COM objects in the middle tier, with SQL Server 2000 as a back end. The Form 50058 submission module is written in J2EE. It has over 3000 configuration items and 3.5 million lines of code. Via Internet and Intranet, it supports more than 22,000 users in HQ, FOs, and over 4000 PHAs. IMS is the system that allows HUD to show who we are assisting, in order to meet Congressional and OMB targets. It provides significant data to EIV (P181) and most REAC systems. Additional Software tools that are not listed in the Programming and Software Environment Section: â€¢ MS Visual Studio 2006

HUD/Security%20Control%20and%20Tracking%.name: Security Control and Tracking System
HUD/Security%20Control%20and%20Tracking%.description: Used to maintain records of employees who have had security investigations.

HUD/Service%20Ticket%20Action%20Resoluti.name: Service Ticket Action Resolution System
HUD/Service%20Ticket%20Action%20Resoluti.description: To create and track IT information and assistance requests to resolution. If calls are resolved by initial contact, call ticket is opened and closed by that agent. If additional work is required by OIT in order to resolve the issue, a "problem ticket" is opened and reassigned to second level technician. Provides detailed IT management reports on systems support.

HUD/Quality%20Management%20Review%20Prog.name: Quality Management Review Program
HUD/Quality%20Management%20Review%20Prog.description: The QMR system is a Lotus Notes Domino/Internet system that provides a streamlined electronic process for administering the Quality Management Review Program reviewer team nominations, questionnaires, plans, interview schedules and findings. The system is administered by ODOC but used by all members of the review teams. The Nomination process involves generation of emails to possible review team participants with a link to a form they complete and submit to the QMR Nominations database. .

HUD/Audit%20Resolution%20and%20Correctiv.name: Audit Resolution and Corrective Action Tracking System
HUD/Audit%20Resolution%20and%20Correctiv.description: ARCATS was migrated from its legacy Lotus Notes platform to the AINS eCase cloud platform as a service (PaaS) on July 21, 2015. ARCATS relies on HUDâ€™s Microsoft Active Directory based general support system (GSS) computer network , eCase role-based permissions assignments security software, and configuration management to protect the system and information.

HUD/Performance%20Accountability%20and%2.name: Performance Accountability and Communication System (PACS/EPACS)
HUD/Performance%20Accountability%20and%2.description: This will capture rating factors for HUD Managers. It is also used for planning the duties of the employees.

HUD/Neighborhood%20Networks.name: Neighborhood Networks
HUD/Neighborhood%20Networks.description: Neighborhood Networks is a community-based program created by HUD in 1995. Through innovative private/public partnerships, Neighborhood Networks facilitates the establishment and maintenance of multi-service community technology centers (CTCs) that bring digital opportunity and life-long learning to low-and moderate-income residents living in Multifamily assisted and/or insured housing. With more than 1,300 Neighborhood Networks centers currently operating in HUD multifamily housing properties throughout all 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Neighborhood Networks continues to grow. Hundreds of additional CTCs operate under HOPE VI, and other Public and Indian Housing programs. The Neighborhood Networks program is assisted in its implementation through approximately 77 HUD Neighborhood Networks Coordinators. Coordinators are located in most of the HUD field offices around the country.

HUD/Prepared%20by%20Client%20Tracking%20.name: Prepared by Client Tracking Database
HUD/Prepared%20by%20Client%20Tracking%20.description: Prepared by Client Tracking Database (PBC) is a tracking system used by the Office of the Chief Financial Officer (OCFO), OIG and Program Offices to track the status and progress of program offices' documentation provided to the OIG to conduct the Department's Consolidated Financial Statements Audit. The system provides a hierarchical view of such requests so that related requests can be grouped. Multiple views are included in the application to provide information specific to either OCFO or OIG users. The system has automatic e-mail notifications built into it that are based on due dates to remind users of pending deadlines or overdue items. The system also has an archive module where previous yearsâ€™ PBC items are stored for future reference. The application allows authorized users to populate items into files for a new fiscal year based on the previous year's items to save time and data entry effort. PBC does not require special software or terminal configurations to operate. In September 2014, PBC was migrated from an in-house Lotus Notes platform to the hosted AINS eCase platform under the same HUD enterprise license as the OCHCO CTS/FMS2 system. The new platform requires only a web browser client to access.

HUD/HUD%20Integrated%20Human%20Resources.name: HUD Integrated Human Resources and Training System
HUD/HUD%20Integrated%20Human%20Resources.description: The HUD Human Resources and Training System (HIHRTS) is an ongoing project that was initiated to replace current legacy systems with a modern Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solution to meet the needs of the Office of Human Resources (OHR) and the HUD Training Academy (HTA). HIHRTS has consolidated the functions of several legacy systems that were in use. These current systems were isolated, unable to communicate with one another, unable to create timely reports, and do not process data quickly. They were not Joint Financial Management Improvement Program (JFMIP) compliant and require manual and intensive processes to work around system weaknesses and to provide critical HR and training information. HIHRTS was designed to select and implement a JFMIP-compliant Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS) ERP package that will support HUD in re-engineering and/or replacing its HR and Training information systems, processes, and procedures to eliminate the deficiencies. This system will improve the Department's ability to meet human capital management needs and support enhanced customer service. In 2002, HUD purchased the COTS solution software package, PeopleSoft Human Resources Management System, with plans to implement without customization, to provide the services needed by the Department to automate HR and Training systems.

HUD/HIHRTS%20DataStore.name: HIHRTS DataStore
HUD/HIHRTS%20DataStore.description: HIHRTS is HUDâ€™s implementation of PeopleSoft HRMS and operates as part of the Department of the Treasuryâ€™s HR Connect system. HUD operates HIHRTS under a signed Inter agency Agreement (IAA) with the Department of the Treasury that was effective November 21, 2005. HIHRTS captures and reports on HUDâ€™s HR and training transactions in a manner consistent with Federal rules and regulations. It enables HUD to meet Departmental and external reporting requirements and maintain responsibility for its own HR and training reporting.

HUD/PHA%20Plans.name: PHA Plans
HUD/PHA%20Plans.description: The system is a utility, where PHAs submit plans in any format (Text, Word, Word Perfect,image or PDF). The PHA website submissions are processed daily by a tool to sort each submission to the proper FO for approval.

HUD/Single%20Sign-On.name: Single Sign-On
HUD/Single%20Sign-On.description: Single Sign On(SSO)is an Enterprise Single Sign-On suite of COTS IT security products. It enables one-time sign-on through the enterprise network. It provides Users with a secured access method to the multiple IT applications for which they are authorized. SSO improves end-user productivity by automating the sign-on process and consolidating different sign-on processes, user-ids and passwords into a single step.

HUD/Enterprise%20Income%20Verification.name: Enterprise Income Verification
HUD/Enterprise%20Income%20Verification.description: EIV is a 3-tiered web application system consisting of a Sun Web Server and a cluster of Sun Glassfish 2.1 Enterprise application Servers implementing Presentation tier and business logic tier. The database is Oracle 11g under the Sun Solaris 10 operating system. Password resets are performed by the REAC Technical Assistance Center.

HUD/Office%20of%20General%20Counsel%20En.name: Office of General Counsel Enterprise Tracking System
HUD/Office%20of%20General%20Counsel%20En.description: The Enterprise Tracking System (ETS) is a tracking system that tracks the work load of OGC Headquarters and Field legal staff. The ETS - Legal Assessment Workload System (LAWS) database allows OGC staff to enter information about cases that have been assigned to them, keep project notes and record actions and dates necessary to complete work on cases. Entries made into the ETS - LAWS database are automatically combined, summarized and reported up the chain of command ultimately to HUD Headquarters. ETS - LAWS uses standard HUD and OGC terminology, program names, and actions, to classify case information. ETS - LAWS replaces the previous version of the LAWS Client Server Database with Java/Oracle and is used to measure the number of actions completed. All ETS modules will be web enabled.

HUD/ArcGIS.name: ArcGIS
HUD/ArcGIS.description: ArcExplorer (version 4 or 9) is a desktop-based COTS application used to display and print maps. It is the free, lightweight companion to ArcView, a full-blown GIS (Geographic Information System) desktop COTS application.

HUD/Human%20Resources%20Entry%20Processi.name: Human Resources Entry Processing Inquiry & Correction System
HUD/Human%20Resources%20Entry%20Processi.description: This system supports the Office of Human Resources. There is a direct link to NFC site that govâ€™t users (HUD) use https://www.nfc.usda.gov/ .

HUD/Policy%20and%20Research%20Informatio.name: Policy and Research Information Server
HUD/Policy%20and%20Research%20Informatio.description: PARIS/P202 provides research support (statistical analysis and database support). PARIS supports all HUD program offices by providing reliable data and analysis.

HUD/Person%20To%20Person%20Chat.name: Person To Person Chat
HUD/Person%20To%20Person%20Chat.description: Person To Person Chat is an online customer support Internet application to facilitate one-on-one discussion with a HUD representative what is identified as a chat room that is moderated by a HUD employee acting as administrator.

HUD/OSEP%20Security%20Control%20System.name: OSEP Security Control System
HUD/OSEP%20Security%20Control%20System.description: The Office of Security and Emergency Planning (OSEP) is responsible for managing HUD's building security access control systems as well as the agency's security camera systems. The access control system utilized by OSEP to control and authorize access to HUD facilities is comprised of a large number of strategically located entry sensors as well as the smartcard readers used to grant building access to HUD personnel, contract staff, and visitor.

HUD/FHA%20Applications%20Data%20Portal.name: FHA Applications Data Portal
HUD/FHA%20Applications%20Data%20Portal.description: FHA Applications & Data Portal is the web site that provides a central access point for information, applications, and systems to support the Systems & Technology (S&T) Division.

HUD/HSG%20Multifamily%20On-Line%20Proper.name: HSG Multifamily On-Line Property Integrated Information Suite Data Mart
HUD/HSG%20Multifamily%20On-Line%20Proper.description: OPIIS â€“ On-line Property Integrated Information Suite (P220): â€¢ Is a data repository. It receives data from DAP, HEREMS/IREMS, PASS, FASS-MF, FHASL, MDDR, Dynaxys, HMIMIS, REIS, HUD Fair Market Rents, Moodyâ€™s, MIT, and Global Insight. The intent is to make better use of the disparate data that HUD already possesses within its independent legacy systems and databases, as well as of data that HUD has purchased. â€¢ Data is cleansed and the format is standardized. â€¢ Data is loaded into a data warehouse. â€¢ OPIIS calculates a risk assessment score for each property and ranks each property as high, moderate, and low risk. â€¢ Provides an Integrated Risk Assessment (IRA) score derived from combined financial, physical inspection, default/delinquency, and management review data. â€¢ Recalculates the IRA whenever any scoring component is updated. â€¢ Provides the ability to produce risk analysis reports of individual properties as well as by HUD Hub or Field Office. â€¢ Is used by field office asset managers, appraisers, and underwriters to more accurately focus their default prevention, loss mitigation, and other risk management activities, and to prioritize their workloads so as to as to address the highest risk properties first. â€¢ Formats financial data into year-over-year comparison reports for analyzing trends. â€¢ OPIIS is fully compliant with the HUD Enterprise Architecture model. â€¢ Online Analytical Processing (OLAP), through a business intelligence tool, provides data mining/analysis, time series, and trend analysis views. The business intelligence tool is a multidimensional data store designed from the outset to provide quick access to pre-summarized data from vast amounts of detailed data. â€¢ Allows users to benchmark the performance of a given multifamily property to its market and to the performance of a group of peer properties. â€¢ Allows users to view historical property performance over time. â€¢ Allows users to view, graph, export, and save customizable reports and graphs. â€¢ Allows users to portray data onto geographical maps to view the geographical distribution and concentrations of risk. â€¢ Allows users to manage credit and operational risk as well as the risk of loss of affordable housing units. â€¢ Allows users to prevent defaults and mitigate losses.

HUD/Voucher%20Management%20System.name: Voucher Management System
HUD/Voucher%20Management%20System.description: The information will be verified through edit checks against VMS, HUDCAPS and PIC systems. In addition, the system will be integrated with HUDCAPS, eLOCCS, PIC 50058 data, and FASS-PH to improve the financial reporting process, provide up-to-date management information, develop a streamlined renewal process to minimize staff processing time, refine the shortfall funding method, and refine additional funding processes. PHAs will submit quarterly data electronically to HUD. Users at the PIH Financial Management Center, Financial Management Division, Quality Assurance Division, Field Offices (FO) and Headquarters (HQ) will access the information required for financial processing and program renewals through a reports server. Existing staff intensive renewal funding procedures would be streamlined; reducing the overall number of staff hours spent each quarter on this activity. The system would provide for the exchange of information between HUD and PHAs. VMS system currently meets the requirements specified in OMB policies, NIST guidance and HUD security policies. Single sign-on implemented in February 2005 for VMS system via the Web Access Security System (WASS). WASS provides access security and all other authentication services for VMS.

HUD/Enterprise%20Electronic%20Records%20.name: Enterprise Electronic Records Management/Correspondence Tracking System
HUD/Enterprise%20Electronic%20Records%20.description: Implementation of the ERM system creates on-line collaboration between program offices and HUD's business partners and clients. The ERM system will support record disposition activities as well as immediate retrieval of historical archived information. The infrastructure that comprises the CTS solution includes the COTS products CATXpress, FOIAXpress, SCANXpress and REDACTXpress by AINS Corp. For purposes of this submission, the CATXpress suite of tools will be referred to as the 'Xpress Toolset'. The Xpress Toolset will work in conjunction with Documentum providing the workflow engine and the eRoom collaboration functionality. The system will run against an Oracle back end database.

HUD/CompareA76.name: CompareA76
HUD/CompareA76.description: COMPARE is a software program designed to assist analysts in developing, documenting, and comparing the relative cost of operating commercial activities by agency, public reimbursable, or private sector sources. CompareA76 is a workstation-based application for which an SMS installation routine can be relatively easily generated.

HUD/Event%20Management%20and%20Registrat.name: Event Management and Registration Control
HUD/Event%20Management%20and%20Registrat.description: On-Line Registration is an online form accessible to the public through hud.gov that allows the public to register for upcoming conferences and seminars held throughout the United States. There is a backend MS SQL database that stores the information submitted through the online form. The Field Managers can run a report of who and how many individuals have registered for each conference or seminar.

HUD/HUD%20Electronic%20Metering%20DASH%2.name: HUD Electronic Metering DASH Board
HUD/HUD%20Electronic%20Metering%20DASH%2.description: The Digital Dashboard software is needed to control the peripherals and this is the only application that needs to be loaded on the client workstation to support the Pitney Bowes solution. The size of this application is 20 Meg.

HUD/Single%20Family%20Integration%20Syst.name: Single Family Integration System
HUD/Single%20Family%20Integration%20Syst.description: An application integration and legacy systems modernization project developed pursuant to the Single Family Target Architecture, employing industry best practices to achieve an on-demand business application services environment.

HUD/SFI%20TransAccess%3A%20Case%20Binder.name: SFI TransAccess: Case Binder Management Module
HUD/SFI%20TransAccess%3A%20Case%20Binder.description: Users need a computer with an internet connection and Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.5 or above. TA is an n-Tier application, running on Sun J2EE Application Server with an Oracle Database, the servers are configured for fail-over and performance optimizing. The TA application servers and database servers are located at the Office of Business Development, Communication and Marketing data center facility in Suwanee, Georgia. The contingency data center is in Charlotte, North Carolina. Weekly full backups are performed on the application servers and the database. Daily incremental backups are performed and the weekly backups are kept off site in a secure storage facility.

HUD/Secure%20Payment%20System.name: Secure Payment System
HUD/Secure%20Payment%20System.description: SPS provides a mechanism by which government agencies can create payment schedules in a secure fashion, and with a strictly enforced separation of duties. This system will allow personnel at FPA locations to submit schedules to FMS over a browser/web interface. The system enables: 1. FPA Data Entry Operators (DEOs) to create and modify payment schedules securely; 2. FPA Certifying Officers (COs) to review and certify payment schedules securely SPS is a â€œthin-client web application.â€ SPS is a Java Applet based application that uses a cryptographic token to securely connect and interact with back-end systems through the Internet Explorer browser.

HUD/Ginnie%20Mae%20Financial%20%26%20Acc.name: Ginnie Mae Financial & Accounting System
HUD/Ginnie%20Mae%20Financial%20%26%20Acc.description: The system is a PeopleSoft application that tracks and records all accounting transactions and contains the data necessary for the preparation of the financial statements of Ginnie Mae.

HUD/Integrated%20Pool%20Management%20Sys.name: Integrated Pool Management System
HUD/Integrated%20Pool%20Management%20Sys.description: IPMS is a proprietary mainframe application that has three major modules: New Pool Processing, Pool Reporting, and Generalized Mortgage Backed Securities. The IPMS is run by The Bank of New York Mellon at their hosting facilities in Tennessee

HUD/Unclaimed%20Funds%20System.name: Unclaimed Funds System
HUD/Unclaimed%20Funds%20System.description: UFS is a network server application. The network applications are secured under Microsoft Serverâ€™s security. Users are required to be authenticated with user ID and password before access is granted to the network.

HUD/Innovation%20of%20the%20Day.name: Innovation of the Day
HUD/Innovation%20of%20the%20Day.description: The primary objective of Innovation of the Day (IOD) is that it be embraced across the agency and become a forum to encourage HUD colleagues, friends, and associates to share emerging practices in housing and urban development. Objectives for IOD are that it will: â€¢ Become a central resource for PD&R to analyze emerging trends, issues, and solutions. â€¢ Spur HUD HQ, field, and regional offices to engage with innovations occurring within their jurisdictionâ€“improving participation, a sense of ownership, connectivity, and morale across the agency. â€¢ Engage domestic and international innovators from public, private, and social sectors in sharing best practices and models â€¢ Generate philanthropic interest, collaborations and/or investment. â€¢ Be a meaningful external engagement tool, demonstrating HUD values new approaches and innovative practices in fulfilling its mission. The four components of IOD include: 1. An online submission form and innovations database: Anyone can submit innovations (HUD staff, local governments, multi-lateral organizations, non-profits, or the general public) to IOD though a straightforward submission form. Thereafter, an internal IOD committee will clear submissions for publishing based on established and OGC-approved criteria. Once cleared, innovations will populate a searchable database that can be filtered by HUD goals, major housing and urban development themes, geography, and/or innovation type. 2. Review and Edit Submitted Innovations An internal IOD committee will review all submitted innovations to validate text and photographs of the submissions. This system will be available internally to HUD staff. 3. Featured Innovation: The IOD committee will select key innovations to feature on the HUD.gov homepage slideshow and HUDuser.org, in addition to the Innovation of the Day landing page. These featured innovations will change/rotate on a weekly basis, enabling us to elevate specific innovations. For example, one week we may want to feature innovations related to homelessness, while another week sustainable communities. Additionally, featured innovations will be shared through social media, emails, and partner sitesâ€”the viral nature helping to fuel the overall initiative. 4. Trend Analysis and Dashboard Tool Anyone will be able to query the submitted innovations. Internally, these submissions will be reviewed by an internal IOD committee before it is available externally.

HUD/National%20Housing%20Locator%20Syste.name: National Housing Locator System
HUD/National%20Housing%20Locator%20Syste.description: To provide the best service to the citizen, protect the publicâ€™s resource and coordinate with other supporting agencies, a case management system must exist to tack dislocated personnel in a disaster and assure the publicâ€™s trust provided aid. The adjunct housing data collection process is required to collect housing information that can not be collected by other private, social service or local government housing data collector.

HUD/FHA-Customer%20Relationship%20Manage.name: FHA-Customer Relationship Management
HUD/FHA-Customer%20Relationship%20Manage.description: This software is used by the FHA Resource Center and HUD staff to document information received from telephone and email inquiries from consumer and FHA industry contacts. On a monthly basis, approximately 60,000 contacts and their applicable information is handled by the FHA Resource Centervia this software.

HUD/Enterprise%20Business%20Information%.name: Enterprise Business Information Transformation System
HUD/Enterprise%20Business%20Information%.description: This tool is used as an information delivery and analysis tool. This tool satisfies HUDâ€™s need for a mature EA information repository developed with current technology compliant with HUDâ€™s future state Technical Architecture.

HUD/Financial%20Management%20Center-Repo.name: Financial Management Center-Reports and Data System
HUD/Financial%20Management%20Center-Repo.description: This system was developed using Microsoft Access 2002. It is a Lan- Based Multi-user system interfacing with various databases and spreadsheets developed in Microsoft Access and Excel. The system uses data downloaded daily from the HUDCAPS Datamart. The system has access to sensitive financial data for Public Housing Authorities nationwide such as budget amounts. An automated process runs daily to limit access to this system during the download process. This system is located on a Local Area Network with access limited to approximately 99 staff assigned to the Financial Management Center (FMC). Users are only allowed access to this system if the Information Technology Division adds their HUD ID to the Lan.

HUD/Asset%20Disposition%20and%20Manageme.name: Asset Disposition and Management System
HUD/Asset%20Disposition%20and%20Manageme.description: ADAMS application is set up as a comprehensive automated data solution to receive, store, and display data, and to perform other core management functions. The Yardi Voyager Workflow Engine is being utilized to implement business rules with targeted workflow sequences, and will be set-up to be used with role-based menu sets for each OSFAM work group. Finally, an industry standard XML data exchange toolset is being used to create import and export data interfaces to external systems. Yardi Systems, Inc. is providing hosting, support, and implementation services for this project. ADAMS is hosted on Dell servers, using the Windows 2003 Server OS. The Graphical User Interface (GUI) has been developed to work specifically with the Windows platform and Internet Explorer 6 and later. ADAMS will: â€¢ Obtain, store, and display case-level information about properties acquired by HUD or in the custody of HUD; â€¢ Track events and information describing the status of real property from the date of conveyance to HUD through several stages of management, marketing, and disposition, to final reconciliation of sale proceed; â€¢ Retain data relative to contracts, contractors, and vendors that support the property disposition program; â€¢ Exchange data with HUD and non-HUD systems and Internet sites for both input and retrieval of data using the BSP data-exchange toolset; â€¢ Provide data security with multiple levels of access for users including HUD employees and designated contractors; â€¢ Provide standard and ad-hoc reporting capability.

HUD/Automated%20Time%20and%20Attendance%.name: Automated Time and Attendance System
HUD/Automated%20Time%20and%20Attendance%.description: The WebTA system is implemented with the goal of increasing the efficiency, accuracy, and accountability of the time and attendance process at HUD. This goal will be met by eliminating the current error-prone, redundant data entry process, by providing more extensive edits at the time of record data entry by the employee, and by assuring that Supervisors certify time and attendance records. 1.Employees will enter their own time and attendance information on a scheduled basis (recommendation is daily basis). 2.Extensive edits will ensure that the time record is technically valid under time and leave rules, prior to review by the designated supervisor. (This feature reduces requirements for employees and supervisors to understand the time and leave rules.) 3.The supervisor or their designee must approve regular and corrected time records prior to transmission of these records to the NFC Payroll/Personnel System. 4.Leave will be requested and approved through an integrated leave module.  System generated E-mail reminder messages will be sent to employees and supervisors when they have missed deadlines for the entry and approval of T&A records. Close coordination between the HR and Program Areas, facilitated by timely status reporting from the WebTA database, will assure that all employees are paid accurately and on time even in circumstances where the employee or supervisor are absent and unable to fulfill their normal reporting or approval roles.

HUD/Lead%20Rule%20Compliance%20Advisor.name: Lead Rule Compliance Advisor
HUD/Lead%20Rule%20Compliance%20Advisor.description: The LeadCA was developed by Mind and Media via a contract with OHHLHC. It was developed using Exsys Corvid Knowledge Automation Expert System Software. There are three aspects of this software - the Corvid development software used to create the expert system; the Corvid Java Applet and helper servlet that drive the expert system; the content software pieces associated with implementing/running the expert system. LeadCA is the OHHLHC Lead Safe Housing Rule Compliance Etool. It is installed on a HUD web server.

HUD/Reporting%20and%20Feedback%20System.name: Reporting and Feedback System
HUD/Reporting%20and%20Feedback%20System.description: RFS will provide immediate feedback to issuers regarding the status of reported data. RFS will be integrated with Ginnie Maeâ€™s Integrated Pool Management System (IPMS) through the shared use of enterprise data via EWODS. RFS will be accessed by Ginnie Mae personnel, Ginnie Mae Contractors, Issuers, and other Federal agencies. RFS is a major application under development as a replacement for the Mortgage-Backed Securities Information System (MBSIS) and related modules. RFS consists of individual modules, each with a different function. These modules are: Pool Accounting/Exception Feedback (PA/EF); Servicemembersâ€™ Civil Relief Act (SCRA); Independent Public Accountant (IPA); Ginnie Mae Portfolio Analysis Display System (GPADS); RFS â€“ Administration (ADMIN); Data Disclosure (DD); Loan Matching and Suspense (MAS); Custodial Account Verification System (CAVS); contact Management (CM); and E-Notification (e-Note).

HUD/Ginnie%20Mae%20Enterprise%20Portal%2.name: Ginnie Mae Enterprise Portal General Support System
HUD/Ginnie%20Mae%20Enterprise%20Portal%2.description: The GMEP is a browser-based system for consolidating and modernizing Ginnie Mae's business applications into one common presentation layer. The GMEP system provides the following functionality: RFS Portlets; GinnieNET Portler(s); Portal Security Administration; Business Objects Support for Reporting; Secure File Uploads; Content Management; General Information Content (e.g., Your Path to Home Ownership). The GMEP GSS uses the Ginnie Mae Enterprise Wide Operational Data Store (EWODS) for data storage. The GMEP will be a single access point for Issuers to do the monthly reporting of pool and loan-level data on Ginnie Mae Mortgage-Backed Securities.Both Ginnie Mae employees and external business partners (e.g., Issuers) will have access to the GMEP. Security roles will be established to ensure that appropriate access is maintained.

HUD/Home%20Equity%20Reverse%20Mortgage%2.name: Home Equity Reverse Mortgage Information Technology
HUD/Home%20Equity%20Reverse%20Mortgage%2.description: This is an outsourced system that provides FHA and its Business Partners with streamlined and fully automated processes for handling the Home Equity Conversion Mortgage (HECM) program. The HECM program allows seniors to convert the equity in their home to cover monthly or unforeseen expenses by means of getting monthly payments and/or lump-sum distributions that are not repaid until the home is sold. The home is sold upon the borrowers' death or the loan is repaid via other means, which results in termination of the FHA Insurance. While the loan is active, disbursements are added to the outstanding balance, along with interest and other applicable fees, up to the calculated limit based on the borrowers' age and the property value. The borrower does not make payments as in a conventional loan, but the loan is repaid either to the lender by sale of the property or other re-payment method, or to HUD if the case has become an Assigned Note. An Assigned Note happens when the outstanding balance reaches 98% or more of its limit, at which time, FHA takes over the servicing of the loan, and pays a Claim to the lender to cover their outlays.

HUD/HUD%20Integrated%20Acquisition%20Man.name: HUD Integrated Acquisition Management System
HUD/HUD%20Integrated%20Acquisition%20Man.description: HIAMS is a web-based commercial-of-the-shelf (COTS) integrated Acquisition procurement contract writing system that generates award documents in accordance with the Federal Acquisition Regulations and interfaces with HUDs Integrated Financial Management Improvement Project (HIFMIP). HIAMS also integrate with the Central Contractor Registry (CCR), Federal Business Opportunity (FedBizOpps) and Federal Procurement Data Systemâ€”Next Generation (FPDS_NG).

HUD/HIAMS%20Enterprise%20Acquisition%20R.name: HIAMS Enterprise Acquisition Reporting Tool
HUD/HIAMS%20Enterprise%20Acquisition%20R.description: The HIAMS Reporting System will pull from multiple access points into a single Data Mart for Reporting. The HIAMS System contains two Databases sources that data will be extracted from; Production and Archive. The Production and Archive databases have similar structures and will be transformed into structures for effective reporting. The PRISM system will be extracted nightly to refresh the Data Mart. The schedule for the PRISM extraction will be defined by CPO based on their production processes. There are other sources to be considered after initial deployment of the base reporting system, including but not limited HUD-CAPS and legacy systems. The Finance system (HUD-CAPS) is used by HIAMS/P273/PRISM. and does extract some financial information which is stored in PRISM. If the content stored in HUD-CAPS could be considered as a source reused views already established.  The HIAMS Reporting System has three distinct environments â€“ a development environment, a user acceptance testing (UAT) environment and the production environment. The development environment is used by the Supporting Contracting team to create new functionality and conduct unit testing. After components are developed and tested by Supporting Contracting Team, they are promoted to the UAT environment. The UAT environment is used to stage the developed enhancements for testing by both the contractor team and HUD. Once components have passed UAT testing, they are promoted to the production environment. The production environment is used by the HUD community to run reports, view dashboards and perform ad hoc queries. Using these multiple environments, the Supproting Contracting Team and HUD can effectively manage the development of new functionality within the HIAMS Reporting System, enhance existing functionality, test new features and components and deploy the overall changes into production for the user community. System Environments The HUD infrastructure support team will provide the three hosting environments for the HIAMS Reporting System â€“ the development environment, the UAT environment and the production environment. HUDâ€™s infrastructure support team will be responsible for the establishment, implementation and ongoing support of each environment.

HUD/Sound%20Transmission%20Classificatio.name: Sound Transmission Classification Assessment Tool
HUD/Sound%20Transmission%20Classificatio.description: The Environmental Planning Division has created the Assessment Tools for Environmental Compliance (ATEC), a collection of guidance documents, calculators, checklists, and databases that addresses the â€œrelated federal laws and authorities." ATEC is intended to help grantees meet their compliance responsibilities and complete their environmental review with greater ease and efficiency. It also aids users in achieving the Department's goal of providing a safe, suitable living environment.

HUD/Human%20Resources%20End-to-End%20Sol.name: Human Resources End-to-End Solution
HUD/Human%20Resources%20End-to-End%20Sol.description: The HR End-to End Solution provides staffing and classification capability with a hybrid solution. This includes HR Connect (Department of the Treasury), OPMâ€˜s USAJobs and USAStaffing System, and the comprehensive AVUE Staffing and Classification tool. Phase 1 will include a Pilot phase to include the program areas of Housing and OCHCO.

HUD/HR%20E2E%20Staff%20Acquisition%20%2F.name: HR E2E Staff Acquisition / EOD
HUD/HR%20E2E%20Staff%20Acquisition%20%2F.description: The HR E2E Performance Management system will provide the Department with an alternative to the current monitoring and tracking of performance management processes that is perceived as being user-friendly by both employees and supervisors. In addition to offering ease in establishing plans (including a cascading feature), the system should provide convenient access to reports that will equip managers with the ability to monitor the progress of all performance documents through the performance cycle.

HUD/HR%20E2E%20Performance%20Management.name: HR E2E Performance Management
HUD/HR%20E2E%20Performance%20Management.description: The HR E2E Performance Management system will provide the Department with an alternative to the current monitoring and tracking of performance management processes that is perceived as being user-friendly by both employees and supervisors. In addition to offering ease in establishing plans (including a cascading feature), the system should provide convenient access to reports that will equip managers with the ability to monitor the progress of all performance documents through the performance cycle.

HUD/HR%20E2E%20Case%20Management.name: HR E2E Case Management
HUD/HR%20E2E%20Case%20Management.description: OCHCO will perform the activities below to determine if the solution achieves the expected outcomes. Management sill monitor, track and analyze costs of program activities over time to demonstrate savings as a result of implementation of the system. Collaborative verification of Service Level agreements between OCHCO, Program Offices and Employees can be met within established targets using the reporting capability of the system. Management will analyze trends in data on a quarterly basis to identify deficiencies that can be resolved through process improvement within the organization, Management/Supervisor training or coaching, or an increase education and marketing to the workforce. Executive leadership ensures that the next generation of leaders maintain high standards of honesty and ethics that serve as a model for the whole workforce. Collaboration, communications, trust, integrity, character, and honesty and so much more can create an environment where leaders promote teamwork and communicate the organizationâ€™s shared vision to all levels of the organization, and seek feedback from employees.

HUD/HR%20E2E%20Talent%20Management.name: HR E2E Talent Management
HUD/HR%20E2E%20Talent%20Management.description: HR E2E TM will provide the capability to develop effective human capital management strategies to ensure federal organizations are able to recruit, select, develop, train, and manage a high-quality, productive workforce in accordance with merit system principles. It implements a comprehensive employee development approach to ensure that agency employees have the right competencies and skills for current and future work assignments. Additionally, this project includes conducting employee development needs assessments; designing employee development programs; administering and delivering employee development programs; and evaluating the overall effectiveness of the agencyâ€™s employee development approach. Functionality will be delivered through multiple sub-tasks.

HUD/HR%20E2E%20Separations%20Management.name: HR E2E Separations Management
HUD/HR%20E2E%20Separations%20Management.description: Conduct efficient and effective employee separation programs that assist employees in transitioning to non-Federal employment; facilitate the removal of unproductive, non-performing employees; and assist employees in transitioning to retirement. Leverage technology to specify and standardize current segmented Separation Management capabilities into a single, formal process which includes the following six activities: 1. Notification of separation 2. Conduct workforce shaping activities 3. Determine terms of separation 4. Provide separation support 5. Conduct knowledge transfer 6. Conduct exit processing

HUD/Lender%20Electronic%20Assessment%20P.name: Lender Electronic Assessment Portal
HUD/Lender%20Electronic%20Assessment%20P.description: The Lender Electronic Assessment Portal (LEAP) is a internet-facing mechanism for organizations who wish to become approved FHA Lenders to submit their application. For prospective lenders, custom pages are presented as part of hud.gov using Oracle WebCenter that allow the lender to register interim credentials (stored in LDAP), record sensitive application information, and respond to information requests. The only function that is accessible without authentication is registration and once registered the only function available is applying to be an approved lender. Lender data is maintained in an Oracle/Siebel database by leveraging Siebel Integration Objects. OLAPC staff access LEAP using Internet Explorer which is extended using the Siebel High-Interactivity Client for greater function.

HUD/Energy%20%26%20Performance%20Informa.name: Energy & Performance Information Center
HUD/Energy%20%26%20Performance%20Informa.description: EPIC will provide the following high-level functions. Ability to: â€¢ Collect, aggregate and report results of the substantial capital investments made through its public housing Capital Fund program and Operating Fund Energy Performance Contracting (EPC) program â€¢ Collect information on the PHA/Tribal implementation of energy efficiency and water conservation measures â€¢ Automate the Annual Statement and P&E process â€¢ Automate the EPC approval process and collect information on energy performance contracts (EPCs) â€¢ Build interfaces to PHA generated Physical Need Assessment/Energy Audit data â€¢ Track the development of new public housing â€¢ Collect electronic submission of the SF-425 quarterly reports â€¢ Collect planned and completed activity data as well as quarterly reports for PIHâ€™s two largest Native American programs.

HUD/Digital%20Identity%20and%20Access%20.name: Digital Identity and Access Management System
HUD/Digital%20Identity%20and%20Access%20.description: Capabilities in DIAMS include: â€¢ Integration with USAccess to automatically initiate the Personal Identification Verification (PIV) processes. â€¢ Integration with HUDâ€™s authoritative sources containing information concerning identities, access rights, credentials, and clearance levels. â€¢ Integration with HUDâ€™s employee on-boarding and separation business processes and supporting IT systems. â€¢ Supporting a self-service web portal for central management of identity requests, approvals, provisioning and de-provisioning activities, credential management, and people-based attribute management. â€¢ Supporting automated business processes and work flows associated with identity, credential and access management. â€¢ Storing core identity attributes for digital identities. â€¢ Providing automatic provisioning and/or de-provisioning of base entitlements to user repositories and HUDâ€™s physical access control system. â€¢ Providing automated self-service password management allowing self service password resets through a centralized web portal. â€¢ Supporting password synchronization services. â€¢ Supporting Application single sign-on for HUD applications. â€¢ Automating situational awareness, status, and compliance reporting associated with ICAM activities.

HUD/Capital%20Needs%20Assessment%20Align.name: Capital Needs Assessment Alignment -IT
HUD/Capital%20Needs%20Assessment%20Align.description: Data and reports generated from the E-tool should be available for individual properties and on a portfolio basis to property owners, lenders, and agency staff as their interests may appear. Portfolio data will permit aggregated reports for selected data items and indices by region, by construction items or categories, by energy savings and related metrics. Such reports will be useful for underwriting, asset management and policy analyses. Meanwhile, at HUD individual property CNAs will be underwritten and revised by MAP Lenders, reviewed by MF Development field staff and updated after Endorsement by Asset Management field staff as repairs and replacements are funded from disbursements from the property Reserve for Replacements escrow. The proposed â€œlivingâ€ or continuously updated CNA will assist Asset Managers and owners in decision making for individual properties. Other agencies likely would use a similar process but would have no obligation to do so.

HUD/Single%20Family%20Handbooks.name: Single Family Handbooks
HUD/Single%20Family%20Handbooks.description: The sole purpose of this system is to provide a storage area for Single Family Handbooks. To achieve that, a move of the FHA Handbooks from an external website (managed by Peniel Solutions) to HWVANWD1299 which is the Development server will be done. Next, the app can be deployed to the Test server (HWVANWT1300) and then into Production (HWVANWP1301). All three of these servers are SQL servers that will allow us to migrate the Single Family Handbooks. Once the Handbooks are in Production, the Housing web team will develop a link to Hud.gov. With the information on Hud.gov, users will be able to access the site via the internet.

HUD/Next%20Generation%20Management%20Sys.name: Next Generation Management System
HUD/Next%20Generation%20Management%20Sys.description: The Next Generation Management System (NGMS) is an Office of Public and Indian Housing (PIH) business-driven investment whose aim is to enhance HUD â€˜ s affordable housing (AH) program management, improve end user satisfaction, streamline complex business processes, and integrate disparate Information Technology (IT) systems into a common, modernized platform. These goals will help improve the agencyâ€™s ability to accurately quantify budgetary data resources, measure program effectiveness, and scrupulously justify the agency s budget formulations and requests. By aligning current and future AH processes, HUD aims to simplify business operations and maximize investment returns with business-driven, service-oriented solutions that employ shared and standardized technology. NGMS will provide an integrated, seamless and singular view of financial and program data used to make real-time business decisions, currently warehoused in disparate data sources. The modernization of affordable housing program data through NGMS will provide HUD executives, Congressional authorizers and appropriators, OMB, public housing agencies, and other stakeholders an enhanced view of HUD s financial accountability. With NGMS' accurate financial data and automated processes, HUD personnel will be able to reduce improper payment errors by identifying operating costs, reserves, and subsidy payment anomalies. Once implemented, NGMS will provide staff with a new set of monitoring, oversight and analysis tools to ensure that allocated federal funds are used efficiently to assist affordable housing participants. NGMS will build project modules across four dimensions: (1) HUD Operations - creating a single point of access to data and key information to reduce HUD s administrative burden; (2) Financial management - developing an automated and more accurate process of budget formulation based on real-time data to reduce errors in budget forecasting; (3) Partner Operations - providing HUD partners with a single point of access to data that will allow them to better serve their customers and operate more efficiently; and (4) Business support - expanding the access and use of the NGMS IT advancements to the HUD enterprise level.

HUD/Budget%20Formulation%20and%20Forecas.name: Budget Formulation and Forecasting
HUD/Budget%20Formulation%20and%20Forecas.description: BFF uses three primary data sources: Voucher Management System (VMS) for voucher data, PIH Information Center (PIC) for the Public Housing Authority (PHA) reference data, and Housing and Urban Development Central Accounting and Program System (HUDCAPS) for data related to the identification of new increments. Data from these sources are accessed through the Public and Indian Housing (PIH) Data Warehouse (DW). The PIH data is input by PHAs and later validated and updated within BFF where necessary to create a verified Frozen Dataset. Additionally, user-supplied reference files provide information not available in PIH DW. These reference files are related to Inflation and Administrative factors that are received periodically. That data is aggregated into the BFF database through an Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) process (using Oracle Stored Procedures). The reporting tool, Hyperion Interactive Reporting (IR), accesses the BFF Data Mart and allows users to produce canned reports and output files (such as the Frozen Dataset). The Frozen Dataset is used for the budget formulation purposes. In the future, the Frozen Dataset will be the data source for the Hyperion Planning application. The Frozen Dataset will be loaded into the Essbase cube and used for budget formulation purposes. The BFF users will access Web Forms to interact with the Hyperion Planning application; verify, validate, update, adjust, and run business rules and calculations; and create the Tenant Based Rental Assistance (TBRA) budget (full details of all business rules and calculations may be found in the BFF Requirements Document). Web Forms are unique to the Hyperion Planning module and are similar to Excel worksheets using Pivot Tables.

HUD/Portfolio%20and%20Risk%20Management%.name: Portfolio and Risk Management Tool
HUD/Portfolio%20and%20Risk%20Management%.description: This project will leverage the reporting functionality currently available in Micro Strategy through an existing operations and maintenance contract, and PIHâ€™s experience with the Portfolio Management Tool (PMT), to jump start the development of system capabilities.

HUD/Business%20Systems%20Management.name: Business Systems Management
HUD/Business%20Systems%20Management.description: HP Business Service Management is a suite of service management software tools developed and marketed by the HP Software Division for end-to-end monitoring of services in the data center and the underlying infrastructure. The latest version, HP BSM 9.0, was designed to serve as a common single platform for managing complex applications, including those supported by both private and public cloud computing, outsourced IT, software-as-a-service (Saas) and traditional IT service delivery. The 9.0 release was made generally available in June 2010 and is part of a portfolio of solutions developed by HP to prevent businesses and government organizations with the management of cloud computing as well as traditional IT service delivery.

HUD/Do%20Not%20Pay%20FMS%20(PKI%20Setup).name: Do Not Pay FMS (PKI Setup)
HUD/Do%20Not%20Pay%20FMS%20(PKI%20Setup).description: The Do Not Pay Business Center was developed, as directed by an Executive Memorandum on June 18, 2010, to support federal agencies in their efforts to reduce the number of improper payment made through programs funded by the federal government. Do Not Pay is a one-stop shop that allows agencies to check various databases before making payments or awards in order to identify ineligible recipients and prevent fraud or errors from being made. To properly utilize Do Not Pay the user will need the following: -Windows XP/Windows 7 -IE 7.0-9.0 -FMS PKI Setup -Treasury Issued PKI Credential FMS PKI Setup allows the user to create and maintain their profile on the PKI Credential issued by Treasury. This key and created profile is a requirement for logging onto the Do Not Pay website. The system can also be used to create keys for other Tresury systems such as SPS (Secure Payment System), also used within the agency.

HUD/Counseling%20Options%20Data%20System.name: Counseling Options Data System
HUD/Counseling%20Options%20Data%20System.description: The HUD Counseling Options Data System (CODS) used to implement the Pre-Purchase Homeownership Counseling Demonstration and Impact Evaluation study. CODS is comprised of 4 components: 1.Abtâ€™s General Computing Environment (GCE) Abtâ€™s GCE will serves as the platform to request and analyze loan origination and credit bureau data. Abtâ€™s company maintains the corporate-wide systems infrastructure, including maintaining and updating desktop software, maintaining AbtNet (the corporate Intranet), and evaluating and implementing new technology that enable our staff to be more efficient and execute project work more effectively. 2.Abtâ€™s FISMA Moderate Enclave (FME) The Enclave is a platform that applications and services can be built upon. For this system, RAST is built on top of the Enclave and inherits many technical, operational, and management controls. The Enclave is a designed to be flexible and efficient. It utilizes a limited amount of hardware and software to reduce overhead. The environment relies upon Abt GCEâ€™s physical controls and internet connection along with many operational and management controls discussed later. The border router is also shared with Abtâ€™s GCE, but it provides no security controls to the system. 3.Random Assignment Service Tracking (RAST) The RAST system supports the random assignment process and data collection of the services provided by counseling agencies. The RAST component is managed by Sage Computing and built upon Abtâ€™s Enclave.

HUD/Location%20Affordability%20Portal.name: Location Affordability Portal
HUD/Location%20Affordability%20Portal.description: LAP is a web application using customized COTS-SaaS, is open to public and requires no authentication.The website is separated onto 2 distinct servers. The parent server, Windows, serves all pages except those in the Cost Calculator and Index tools. The Linux server serves the Cost Calculator and Index tools, which include the mapping components. Both tools are integrated in to the parent server/site via IFRAMES.

HUD/Loan%20Application%20Management%20Sy.name: Loan Application Management System
HUD/Loan%20Application%20Management%20Sy.description: The Loan Application Management System encompasses the ability to support the organization with analysis using FHA aggregate data to identify emerging issues and trends in borrower/collateral risk and fraud. This includes analysis covering valuation accuracy, asset and income validation, employment verification, occupancy verification, and fraud services

HUD/New%20Core%20Interface%20Solution.name: New Core Interface Solution
HUD/New%20Core%20Interface%20Solution.description: The NCIS is a custom developed system hosted by Oracle Managed Cloud Services (OMCS), a FedRAMP Compliant Could Service Provider, and comprised of products from the Oracle Software Stack including Oracle Database, Oracle Application Express (APEX), and Oracle WebLogic. NCIS is a two-tier architecture, consisting of the application tier and database tier. The NCIS performs the Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) functions, as well as a variety of error processing, reconciliation, and interface file management functions to support the interface of HUD systems with ARCâ€™s systems. The NCIS has a user interface which permits a small community of users within OCFO System to upload and maintain crosswalk tables, monitor interface processes, and resolve errors. All data will be sent to and from the NCIS via HUDâ€™s SFTP Server.

HUD/Grants%20Management%20System.name: Grants Management System
HUD/Grants%20Management%20System.description: The Grants Management System (GMS) automates the OER grant management business processes. The GMS is a web based application that receives grant applications from Grants.gov via HUDâ€™s Grants Interface Management System (GIMS II). GMS uses a central database to support the full cradle-to-grave grants lifecycle including Pre-Award, Award, Post-Award Monitoring, and Closeout. The OER GMS is a high-availability application that supports collaboration among teams spread across different geographical regions. The application uses an extensible SOA based architecture that is flexible and scalable with the ability to adapt to the dynamic needs of various grants programs. The GMS is a web-based tool that is currently hosted in the cloud via Amazon Web Services (AWS). The GMS was built using the Java EE 5 architecture. The relational database server is Oracle 11g. The application is deployed on a GlassFish application server. The code for the application was developed by Pyramid Systems, Inc. The OER GMS supports internal HUD Users as well as the external Grantees via the user roles defined for the system. The system supports up to 500+ users and about 200 concurrent users at a time.

HUD/FEMA-HUD%20Data%20Exchange.name: FEMA-HUD Data Exchange
HUD/FEMA-HUD%20Data%20Exchange.description: A web service will be built, residing behind secure systems, that will permit the exchange of data between FEMA and HUD. Exact configuration is yet to be determined, and all potential designs will be vetted and weighed accordingly. This utility will interface with PIC and TRACS information from the PIC Data Warehouse.

HUD/HUD%20Pay.gov%20Common%20Service.name: HUD Pay.gov Common Service
HUD/HUD%20Pay.gov%20Common%20Service.description: PGRequestor (running on the FHAC server) would make the call to PIN 22 (req3) and obtain agency Id, agency tracking Id and application name for the next payment to be processed (whether initial send or resend). Agency Id, agency tracking Id and application name will be sent to HPCS, which resides in the Microsoft Azure Cloud, via a REST API. The REST API will enforce authentication through white listed IP addresses. The traffic will be completely encrypted using TLS1.1 or above protocol. HPCS will post data collection request to Retpmt.cfm to obtain complete transaction data for the Agency ID. Retpmt.cfm will return payment information to HPCS. HPCS will transform the data received for OCI service to the format required by the TCS service. In the payload please note that the TCS APP ID to be used corresponds one to one with the existing application names that are being used. HPCS will assign a unique transaction ID to each transaction and in case of a batch of transactions to the whole batch also. This ID and the agency tracking id received from FHAC will be returned back with a status of â€œreceivedâ€. The transaction is pushed into a queue and then HPCS dequeuer will check the status of payment in its own database if it has already been previously received or processed, if not it makes the TCS call to pay.gov and processes the payment and obtains the status. .

HUD/Enterprise%20Requirement%20Managemen.name: Enterprise Requirement Management Tool
HUD/Enterprise%20Requirement%20Managemen.description: The Enterprise Requirement Management Tool (EMRT) is the enterprise standard for requirement management at HUD. The tool is a cloud-based COTS product created and maintained by RequirementOne and powered by Microsoft. The tool is hosted within the HUD Azure Cloud environment. The tool is composed of four tightly integrated applications: â€¢ Planning App - keep a finger on the pulse of your projects â€¢ Specifications App - know the precise status of each requirement â€¢ Feedback App - gather input from all stakeholders â€¢ Issues App - identify defects linked to requirements The Front-End is composed of: RequirementONE, Javascript & Styling Framework (jQuery, HTML, CSS).The Application Programming Interface (API) is composed of: Web services (WSDL, REST), Biling Engine and WebHooks..

HUD/Departmental%20Enforcement%20Center%.name: Departmental Enforcement Center Management System
HUD/Departmental%20Enforcement%20Center%.description: The Secretary has given the Enforcement Center the responsibility to track all enforcement actions throughout the Department. DECMS is a highly specialized tracking and reporting system for HUD enforcement activities. It provides ability to manage workload and track performance goals to ensure timely processing and closure of physical, financial, and non-filer cases thus improving management practices of multifamily housing partners while reducing fraud, waste and abuse of government funds.

HUD/Enforcement%20Center%20Program%20Com.name: Enforcement Center Program Compliance Integration System
HUD/Enforcement%20Center%20Program%20Com.description: ECPCIS is a Web-based application used by the U. S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) Departmental Enforcement Center (DEC) to facilitate the issuance, tracking, monitoring and oversight of cases brought about by non-compliance to the Department's statutory and regulatory requirements, and cases that are subject to enforcement actions. ECPCIS is composed of five (5) modules: Administrative Proceedings (AP), Program Enforcement (PE), Compliance Tracking System (CTS), Limited Denial of Participation (LDP), and Enforcement Center (EC). Interrelated to ECPCIS is the LDP Listing. Through the Internet, the LDP Listing enables the public to view names of individuals or organizations that have been notified of their â€œlimited participationâ€ status or that have been denied access to HUD programs for a specific period of time.

HUD/Office%20of%20General%20Counsel%20E-.name: Office of General Counsel E-Discovery Management System
HUD/Office%20of%20General%20Counsel%20E-.description: E-Discovery Management System provides a comprehensive system for creating standards for implementation of E-Discovery model to comply with the preservation and production requirements for Electronically Stored Information (ESI), paper records, and other evidence imposed by Federal Rules of Civil Procedures dated 12/1/2006.

HUD/HUD%20Enforcement%20Management%20Sys.name: HUD Enforcement Management System
HUD/HUD%20Enforcement%20Management%20Sys.description: HEMS provides a shared Oracle database/WebLogic Java application for executing enforcement activities for participating Program Offices. Access is provided through WASS for external and internal users, utilizing SiteMinder for Single Sign-On.

HUD/OGC%20Law%20Manager.name: OGC Law Manager
HUD/OGC%20Law%20Manager.description: LawManager is a COTS application that is commonly used in private Law Firms and other Government agencies to ensure timely completion of legal case workload, quality customer service, and data reporting. It is hosted in the Cloud by Amazon Web Services (AWS). OGCLM access is limited to OGC employees, and the internal content is further limited by role to those involved with each individual case. Historically, OGC has inputted over 600,000 workload items a year.

USDOT/PARSE.name: PARSE
USDOT/PARSE.description: Police Accident Report Sampling Engine (PARSE) is a web application Production within CDAN to collect, manage, store and make available to CDAN data acquisition projects, Police Accident Reports (PAR) data collected via electronic or physical methods for the purposes of selection within a appropriate NHTSA data collection program.

USDOT/CISSWeb.name: CISSWeb
USDOT/CISSWeb.description: Crash Investigation Sampling System (CISS) Web (CISSWeb) application consists of motor vehicle crash and injury data collected from Police Accident Reports (PARS) gathered through a network of remote field sites around the country operated and managed under contract by NHTSA.  CISSWeb is the application that consolidates all the data collected within the lifecycle of the case, regardless of the source. Specific PARs are selected for followup investigation via a sample algorithm designed to target towed late model vehicle, specific injuries and/or crashes of special interest to NHTSA. In addition to PAR and injury data, field Data Technicians collect data by inspecting and recording damage to case vehicles, inspecting and collecting data from crash scenes and enhancing vehicle and scene data with digital imagery. When possible, contractors conduct occupant interviews.  NHTSA uses the CISS data collected to evaluate the conditions present at the time of the crash, injuries resulting from crashes, vehicle crashworthiness, special types of crashes (e.g., air bag deployment), and crashes of high public interest (e.g., school bus crashes).

USDOT/iREx.name: iREx
USDOT/iREx.description: iREx (integrated Risk Executive) is a NHTSA-developed  automated Risk Management system for its IT investments. It is compliant to federal regulations (implements NIST SP 800-37 Risk Management Framework guidance and processes) to ensure that Risk-based decision making is a tangible feature of the NHTSA risk management processes. It is collaboratively used by NHTSA's PMO, EA, CPIC and cybersecurity components in risk-based decisioning. iREx ensures that risk mitigation is linked to identifiable combinations of security issues that are recorded and managed in order to address and measure each relevant risk and vulnerability.  iREx is a web-based application with a SQL-based database back-end.  It has capabilities to generate Assessment and Analysis reports used to support DOT/NHTSA Risk Posture, and C&A of its IT systems.

USDOT/NAF.name: NAF

USDOT/MR%20Tool%20(SDAG).name: MR Tool (SDAG)
USDOT/MR%20Tool%20(SDAG).description: MR Tool (Service Data Architecture Group Metadata Repository) is the NHTSA-developed DOT standard system that supports  DOT's continuing implementation of OMB M-13-13 (through DOT Order 1351.34) for DOT OA data and information to be disclosed rapidly in forms that the public can readily find and use.  As such, it is tailored as an analysis and reporting system holding metadata  describing DOT OA datasets, and is designed to conform to the latest federal Open Data metadata schema (https://project-open-data.cio.gov/v1.1/schema/).

TravelOnTrack generates summary reports on available funds and usage of approved/proposed travels and other travel-related reports.

USDOT/SISAME.name: SISAME
USDOT/SISAME.description: NHTSA funded the development of the SISAME program starting in the late 1980�s until the mid 2000�s. USDOT/vPIC-List.name: vPIC-List
USDOT/vPIC-List.description: The NHTSA Product Information Catalog and Vehicle Listing (vPIC) is a consolidated platform that presents data collected within the manufacturer reported data from CFR 49 Parts 551 � 574 for use in a variety of modern tools. NHTSA�s vPIC platform is intended to serve as a centralized source for basic Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) decoding, Manufacturer Information Database (MID), Manufacturer Equipment Plant Identification and associated data.  vPIC is primarily intended for use on Model Years 1995 forward. Data prior to 1995 may be available depending on the manufacturer, which is based on submittals received by NHTSA. This includes passenger vehicles, trucks, buses, trailers / trailer kits, incomplete vehicles, low speed vehicles and motorcycles to name a few as the primary categories. Vehicles within these major categories are further defined by the details provided by the manufacturers in accordance to reporting standards of CFR 49 Part 565 and 566.

USDOT/Unmanned%20Aircraft%20Systems%20Re.name: Unmanned Aircraft Systems Registration Service (UASRS)
USDOT/Unmanned%20Aircraft%20Systems%20Re.description: The Unmanned Aircraft Systems Registration Service (UASRS) is used by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to provide small Unmanned Aircraft System (sUAS) operators/owners a service to register all sUAS for the purpose of Production sUAS in U.S. air space. sUAS are defined as those aircraft that weigh more than 0.55 pounds but less than 55 pounds. This service educates new operators about airspace rules so they can use their unmanned aircraft safely. As part of the registration process, registrants acknowledge that they have read, understand, and intend to follow the safety guidance. The service allows the FAA to identify and take enforcement action against those who intentionally violate the rules or operate unsafely.
USDOT/Unmanned%20Aircraft%20Systems%20Re.vcs: Amazon EC2 is hosted in multiple locations worldwide. These locations are composed of regions and Availability Zones. Each region is a separate geographic area. Each region has multiple, isolated locations known as Availability Zones.

EPA/My%20Right%20to%20Know%20(MyRTK).name: My Right to Know (MyRTK)
EPA/My%20Right%20to%20Know%20(MyRTK).description:
Source code and documentation for MyRTK.  
  
MyRTK is an EPA Web application designed for mobile devices. For any location or address, MyRTK maps nearby facilities that report to the Toxics Release Inventory (TRI), as well as large permit holders in EPA's Air, Water, or Hazardous Waste programs that are expected to produce, manage, or release TRI-reportable chemicals.  
  
This application compares toxic chemical releases from individual facilities to releases from other facilities in the same county, as well as to releases from other facilities in the same industry sector. MyRTK also identifies the most serious facility non-compliance across the twelve most recent quarters of data for the three main United States environmental statutes: the Clean Air Act, the Clean Water Act, and the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.
